page.title: 08 DENTON CHURCH MURALS
page.content: St.Margaret's Church Denton,stands on a mound in the centre of the village.The outside of the building is very attractive,being built of the local reddish-brown sandstone but the inside was very plain and uninviting until the 1960's. Then it was decided that the church should be decorated. Mr Henry Bird(a local artist)was asked to design a set of murals.He used local people as models. The theme for the murals echoed the medieval plan thus:- At the ends of the aisles are Biblical scenes.The west end is decorated with scenes from Denton's History.The South side has pictures of interest to children while the North side has a picture of Salome.(It is dedicated to the women).The chancel has scenes of early Christianity.
